intro: Osteospermum sonchifolium, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pink petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Its foliage is generally hairy and has a serrated edge, while its stems are erect and branching. Osteospermum sonchifolium is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
